intro: Tetrameris isanthera, commonly known as the Isanthera tetrameris, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
